channel.title: No-IP Registration
channel.description:
Hiya, because of my dynamic IP I guessed that instead of my current IP address, I could just replace it with my No-IP address to connect to my registration page: http://56k-hype.no-ip.biz/register.php
I'm trying to test it but the page can never be displayed. Am I supposed to change a setting? I thought No-IP was just a static substitute for your normal IP address?
I'm still looking around for an answer else where. It's no good having a server that no one can access the registration page. Anyone know what they are doing with this sort of thing?
Thanks for reading.

item.title: No-IP Registration
item.dc:creator: @Unit666 Unit666
item.description:
@Unit666 wrote:

could i likes try its out?

Read full topic

item.title: No-IP Registration
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Oh fucking awesome. Let me check if it went to MySQL.

Edit: Thanks man, I now realize it works I just have to use localhost myself. You don’t have the correct client so you wouldn’t be able to log in properly - I’m hosting for beta testing sometime soon via my development thread though, if you’re interested.

Thanks once again.

Read full topic
